title: White House Says Israel ‘Mindful’ of Need to Protect Civilians
description: Israel acknowledged the need to be careful about protecting civilians in its discussions with the US, National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said, as fighting resumed in Gaza.

title: Asia Cheers Biden-Xi Meet But Wants More US Trade, Official Says
description: Asian nations eager for the US and China to get along were pleased that Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping met face-to-face last month, but still want deeper trade relations with Washington, a senior US official said.

title: Who Are the Sikh Separatists Straining India’s Relationship With US and Canada?
description: US prosecutors are accusing an agent of India’s government of directing a plot to assassinate a US citizen of Sikh faith who sought an independent Sikh state. That plot, in New York, was thwarted, but another one allegedly carried out around the same time against an associate in British Columbia was successful, prompting a public accusation from Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada and vigorous denials from India. India says it’s conducting an investigation into the US allegation. The alleged

title: Next Beats on Economy Will Have Both Parties Tuning 2024 Message
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. White House correspondent Akayla Gardner wraps up the most important political and economic news of the week in US. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump Lawyer Says No Georgia Trial in 2025 If He Wins Race
description: Donald Trump’s lawyer in Georgia said Friday that if his client wins the presidency next year, he can’t face a state racketeering trial until after he leaves office.

title: Arab Nations Push for UN Action to Open More Gaza Aid Corridors
description: A group of Arab nations including the United Arab Emirates and Egypt is pushing for new humanitarian corridors to increase the flow of aid to the Gaza Strip, according to people familiar with the matter, an effort that gained new urgency as Israel resumed its bombing campaign after the end of a seven-day truce.

title: Ireland’s Donohoe Is Considering a Bid to Be Next Head of IMF
description: Ireland’s Paschal Donohoe, whose leadership of euro-area finance ministers has elevated his global profile, is considering a bid to lead the International Monetary Fund, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Russia to Increase Size of Military But Says No Mobilization
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree expanding the country’s armed services amid his ongoing invasion of Ukraine.

title: SpaceX Carries South Korea’s First Spy Satellite to Space
description: One of Elon Musk’s rockets carrying a South Korean spy satellite took off for orbit as the rivalry between the two Koreas expands beyond Earth.

title: US Rejects Japan’s Request to Ground Osprey Aircraft After Deadly Crash
description: The US rejected a Japanese government request to ground its fleet of CV-22 Osprey aircraft in the country after a deadly crash, a rare public disagreement between the treaty allies.

title: House Speaker Johnson Drops China Investment Curbs From Defense Bill
description: Speaker Mike Johnson rejected bipartisan efforts to use a must-pass defense bill to tighten controls on US investment in Chinese technology, tasking several of his chairmen instead with resolving their differences on the matter by early next year, people familiar with the decision said.

title: George Santos’s Ouster Sets Up Crucial House Race in New York Suburbs
description: The expulsion of George Santos from Congress Friday triggers a new election in New York City suburbs that threatens to further weaken Republicans’ already shaky control of the US House.

title: Spectator Takeover Put On Hold During UK Telegraph Probe
description: RedBird IMI doesn’t plan to acquire Britain’s Spectator magazine until after a government investigation focused on its proposed acquisition of the Telegraph newspaper is complete, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: US Sanctions Three More Shippers Over Russian Oil Price Cap Violations
description: The US Treasury sanctioned three more firms and vessels for violating the $60-per-barrel price cap on Russian oil, bringing the total number of enforcement actions to eight.

title: King Charles’s Greek-Flag Tie Raises Eyebrows After Sunak Snub
description: King Charles III sported a tie emblazoned with the Greek flag while meeting Rishi Sunak in Dubai — just days after the UK prime minister found himself embroiled in a diplomatic spat with the country.

title: Santos Is Expelled From Congress After a Tumultuous Year of Lies
description: The US House expelled George Santos, ending a brief but sensational turn in national politics by a serial fabulist now under criminal indictment for fraud, theft and lying to the government.

title: Blinken Says Hamas to Blame for End of Week-Long Gaza Truce
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken blamed Hamas for the end of the end of a week-long truce that resulted in the release of dozens of hostages from the Gaza Strip, saying the group had reneged on its commitments and fired rockets that killed and wounded civilians.

title: EU Defense Bonds Needed as Russia Threatens Region, Estonia Says
description: The European Union should issue joint debt to help support its defense sector and provide more backing for Ukraine, according to Estonia’s premier, part of a new push in the region for such a move.

title: Trump Loses Immunity Fight in Appeal Over Jan. 6 Civil Lawsuits
description: Former President Donald Trump isn’t currently entitled to absolute immunity against civil lawsuits seeking to hold him responsible for the violence at the US Capitol during the Jan. 6, 2021, attack, a federal appeals court has ruled.

title: Mexico to Increase Its Minimum Wage by 20% During Election Year
description: Mexico will increase the minimum wage by 20% starting on Jan. 1, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador announced Friday, pressing on with a policy that helped boost domestic consumption at a time the central bank is trying to contain inflation.

title: Slovak Truckers Join Polish Drivers in Ukraine Border Blockade
description: Truckers in Slovakia joined Polish counterparts in staging a blockade at the border with Ukraine, escalating a protest over competition that Kyiv says has disrupted crucial humanitarian aid imports.

title: Republicans Move Toward Biden Impeachment Inquiry Vote Next Week
description: House Republicans are preparing to vote to formally authorize an impeachment inquiry against President Joe Biden as early as next week.

title: Bob Menendez Case Sparks New Jersey Review of SEC, DOJ Officials
description: The New Jersey attorney general is reviewing the conduct of two law enforcement officials caught up in the federal bribery case against US Senator Robert Menendez.

title: NYC’s $15 Congestion Pricing Risks Delay From New Jersey Lawsuit
description: While New York City’s push to charge motorists $15 to enter Manhattan’s congested central business district next year inched forward Thursday with the release of a recommended toll structure, a pending lawsuit by New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy has put that timeline in limbo.

title: Florida’s Biggest Insurer Is Focus of Senate Committee Probe
description: Democratic Senator Sheldon Whitehouse of Rhode Island asked Florida’s biggest property insurer for documents on how it plans to address losses from climate-related weather events.

title: US Sets Stringent Limits on Chinese Content for EV Tax Credit
description: The number of electric vehicles eligible for consumer tax credits in the US is poised to shrink after the Biden administration set rigorous limits on the amount of materials manufacturers can source from China and other foreign adversaries.

title: South Africa Extends Special Permits for Foreign Nationals
description: South Africa will extend special permits granted to immigrants from Zimbabwe and Lesotho by two years after the Supreme Court of Appeal barred the authorities from rescinding them.

title: Senate Border Policy Talks Drag, Jeopardizing US Aid to Ukraine
description: Senators are struggling to strike a long-elusive compromise on US-Mexico border policy that Republicans insist is needed for assistance to Ukraine to pass Congress.

title: Madagascar’s Top Court Validates President’s Re-Election
description: Madagascar’s top court validated the outcome of last month’s election in which President Andry Rajoelina secured another five-year term in office.

title: Sunak Plays Good COP
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Battery Startup Opens Chicago Plant as US Seeks to Curb Reliance on China
description: NanoGraf to use facility to provide key ingredient for longer-lasting batteries

title: Putin’s Conductor Ally Gergiev to Head Russia’s Bolshoi Theater
description: Conductor Valery Gergiev was named director of Russia’s Bolshoi Theater, putting the longtime supporter of President Vladimir Putin at the head of the country’s most prestigious cultural institution.

title: Hungary to Slash FX Debt Sales as EU Fund Prospects Brighten
description: Hungary plans to cut its issuance of foreign-currency bonds next year based on plans to reduce spending and as the outlook brightens for the resumption of funding from the European Union.

title: Binance’s VIP Traders Got Sneak Peek of Record US Crypto Penalty
description: As the contours of Binance Holdings Ltd.’s multibillion-dollar settlement with US authorities coalesced in September, some of its biggest traders who were in Singapore attending a conference got a preview.

title: The World Risks Sliding Into a New Global War
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Greek PM Says 'It Takes Two To Tango' After UK Elgin Marbles Dispute
description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said he wants to preserve good relations with London, following a cancellation of his meeting with his British counterpart Rishi Sunak amid a dispute over the so-called Parthenon Sculptures.

title: Hong Kong Reporter ‘Missing’ After China Trip Is Safe, SCMP Says
description: A reporter for Hong Kong’s premier English-language newspaper is “safe” in China, the publication said, after a news report claimed she’d been unreachable since traveling to Beijing in October.

title: Wall Street Takes Fight Over Arcane Banking Rules to Main Street
description: Big banks want to convince the public they should worry about Basel III financial regulations.

title: Sunak Says Patience Is ‘Wearing Thin’ Over Blocked Rwanda Plan
description: Rishi Sunak said his “patience is wearing thin” over the UK’s inability to push through its flagship Rwanda deportation plan, as he prepares to publish legislation to force the controversial policy past the courts.

title: US and Allies Impose New Sanctions on Old North Korean Foe
description: The US and three of its partners united to impose sanctions on North Korea for its spy satellite launch, with a primary target being an arms-trading company that has been subject to international punishment for more than a decade.

title: Transnet Bond Jumps by Record on $2.5-Billion South African Aid
description: Transnet SOC Ltd.’s bonds gained the most on record after South Africa’s National Treasury agreed to provide a 47 billion-rand ($2.5 billion) support package to the nation’s beleaguered rail and ports operator.

title: An Island Thrives by Welcoming Migrants
description: Lampedusa has become synonymous with refugees and locals want visitors to know about their struggles.

title: Israel Resumes War With Hamas in Gaza After Week-Long Truce
description: Smoke billows in Rafah following an Israeli air raid on the southern Gaza Strip city on Dec. 1 as fighting resumed. Photographer: SAID KHATIB/Getty Images

title: Putin Seizes Rights to St. Petersburg Airport From Foreign Investors
description: President Vladimir Putin ordered the transfer of all the rights to managing St. Petersburg’s Pulkovo airport from foreign shareholders that include Germany’s Fraport AG and the Qatari wealth fund by shifting their stakes into a new Russian entity.

title: Israel Says Hamas Violated Terms of Cease-Fire as Truce Lapses
description: Israel and Hamas resumed their war in the Gaza Strip on Friday morning after a week-long truce ended with the two sides failing to agree on the release of more hostages held by the militant group.

title: Anduril Builds a Tiny, Reusable Fighter Jet That Blows Up Drones
description: Palmer Luckey’s California startup says the US will deploy its Roadrunner weapon in the field next year.

title: Fears of a New World War Prey on Hedge Fund Titans and Policymakers Alike
description: The proliferation of interconnected conflicts is sparking comparisons with world wars past — and focusing policymakers on measures to prevent escalation

title: DeSantis, Newsom Face Off to Rally Base With Eyes on the White House
description: Governors Ron DeSantis of Florida and Gavin Newsom of California sparred over taxes, border security and energy, in a debate that unfolded as a sideshow to the 2024 presidential race — and perhaps a glimpse of the next one.

title: Xi Takes Flurry of Small Steps to Open China After US Trip
description: President Xi Jinping’s government has vowed all year to restore foreign investors’ shattered confidence in China. Since a meeting with US leader Joe Biden steadied ties, Beijing is gradually putting his words into action.

title: South Korea President Forms New Post for Policy Ahead of Vote
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol created a new position for policy and replaced all five of his senior secretaries, just months before an election where his party is trying to regain control of parliament.

title: Myanmar's Military Is Losing Ground Against Coordinated Militia Attacks, AP Reports
description: BANGKOK (AP) — About two weeks into a major offensive against Myanmar's military-run government by an alliance of three well-armed militias of ethnic minorities, an army captain, fighting in a jungle area near the northeastern border with China, lamented that he'd never seen such intense action.

title: Modi’s Rivals Amplify Caste Divide in Bid to Win India Elections
description: The Congress Party is promising to unlock new opportunities for India’s most disenfranchised groups, starting with a national census.
